item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Was February 2025’s Best-Selling Game In The US
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/monster-hunter-wilds-was-february-2025s-best-selling-game-in-the-us/

Monster Hunter Wilds was the best-selling game of February 2025 in the United States (US), knocking Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 from the top spot after four months.

In the latest sales data from Circana, four of the top five games from February were brand new releases. Coming in second was Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 while Civilization 7 and PGA Tour 2K25 were third and fourth, respectively. Rounding out the top five was NBA 2K25, which fell from second.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 finished sixth.

Regarding new game releases, six releases found their way into the top 10 for February after just one made the top 20 in January. Aside from what was mentioned above, the other new games that made February’s list of best sellers were Avowed at seven and Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii at eight.

Lastly, a number of games that found themselves near the top of the sales charts for months have continued to fall. In addition to the aforementioned Call of Duty and NBA 2K25, EA Sports College Football 25 has fallen out of the top 10 for the first time, coming in at 16th compared to seventh. The only game to stay in its same spot from month to month is Elden Ring at 18.

You can check out the full list of the best-selling games for February 2025 below. And let us know what games in the top 20 you’ve played in the comments and over at the Insider Gaming forums.

Top 20 Best-Selling Games For February 2025

  1. Monster Hunter Wilds
  2. Kingdom Come: Deliverance II
  3. Civilization VII
  4. PGA Tour 2K25
  5. NBA 2K25
  6. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  7. Avowed
  8. Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii
  9. Grand Theft Auto V
  10. Madden NFL 25
  11. Minecraft
  12. EA Sports FC 25
  13. Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
  14. Red Dead Redemption II
  15. Hogwarts Legacy
  16. EA Sports College Football 25
  17. Helldivers II
  18. Elden Ring
  19. Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero
  20. Astro Bot

For more Insider Gaming, read about the first-of-its-kind union that has recently formed in North America. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Plants vs Zombies Reloaded Has Been Rated in Brazil Sparking Remaster Discussions
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/plants-vs-zombies-reloaded/

A game called Plants vs Zombies Reloaded has been rated by the Brazil rating board, sparking discussion that a remaster of the original could be in development.

The rating, which simply says “Plants vs Zombies Reloaded” was rated for the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series S/X, PC, Nintendo Switch, and mobile with an ‘L’ rating.

Plants vs Zombies was first developed and published by PopCap Games in May 2009 and later was acquired by EA in July 2011. Despite the initial game being a success and multiple spin-offs and a few sequels, the Plants vs Zombies community has criticized the developers for not replicating the success of the original game.

“I hope it means ea (or popcap idk if they can make decisions by themselves) will get his shit together to deliver a proper sequel in the future but at this point the mere thought of it falls into hopium territory, they fumbled the franchise so hard that it hurts,” said Reddit user kdk_2002.

“Thankfully you don’t have to even look to EA, I sure as hell don’t, since the fans have taken it upon themselves to continue PvZ and have made a plethora of great mods expanding upon PvZ1 and PvZ2. We’re eating good and not giving EA a dime, as it should be until they deliver something actually worth paying for,” said another user.

Would you welcome a Plants vs Zombies remaster? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fallout 76’s Ghoul Within update, which lets players transform into a Ghoul. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: United Videogame Workers Union Officially Launches In North America
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/united-videogame-workers-union-official-launches-in-north-america/

United Videogame Workers (UVW), in conjunction with the Communication Works of America (CWA) and the American Federation of Musicians (AFM) have announced the first ever industry-wide, direct-join union in North America. The UVW-CWA Local 9433 was revealed during Game Developers Conference (GDC) 2025 in San Francisco, California.

As a direct-join union, anyone working in the video game industry in both the United States and Canada can join. That includes artists, developers, QA tester, and more whether they are freelance or full time. It also doesn’t matter how many people from their specific company have joined.

“The creation of this union was not done in isolation; it’s a cumulative effort by the thousands of video game workers who have been fighting for years to redefine what it means to stand together and reclaim power in one of the largest and highest-grossing industries on the globe,” said CWA’s Senior Director of Organizing Tom Smith via press release. “These workers are taking a bold stand, joining together to build power for the workers behind the games we all know and love.”

CWA President Claude Cummings Jr. added: “As video game studios have consolidated, the workers whose creativity, dedication, and skill bring the games to life have become more an afterthought. They are subject to endless cycles of layoffs and rehiring as corporate executives pursue short-term profits at the expense of a sustainable future.”

The press release adds that as part of the union’s launch, its members will be running a petition “demanding dignity and job security for all video game workers, particularly those facing layoffs.” They will also have a large presence around GDC 2025, including panels and other events.

The unions mission statement reads:

Our mission is to take back our lives, our labor, and our passion from those who treat us like replaceable cogs; to empower our fellow workers; to link up arms with the laid off, with the freelancer, with the disillusioned contractor, with the disenfranchised and the marginalized, with the workers laboring invisibly to keep this industry afloat. We are going to create a game industry that works for us, one that nourishes its talent and invests in its future, rather than constantly seeking short-term profits. We are the ones that make the games, so we must be the ones that set the terms of how we work.

As of publishing, there have been a known 1,493 jobs lost due to layoffs in 2025 across 47 companies. This comes after an estimated 16,000 people lost their jobs in 2024.

For more Insider Gaming, read why EA sources are confident an agreement to continue the licensing agreement between the studio and the NFL will happen. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Xbox’s One-Handed ‘Adaptive Joystick’ Controller is Now Available For $29.99
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-adaptive-controller/

Xbox has released it’s one-handed adaptive joystick controller aimed at players with limited mobility.

The adaptive controller, which is priced at $29.99 / £24.99 was first announced in August 2024 and is aimed at players that have issues with controllers that have two analogue sticks.

“Refine your gaming experience with the configurable, wired Xbox Adaptive Joystick – designed as a companion for the Xbox Adaptive Controller and other Xbox controllers (sold separately). Made to meet the needs of players with limited mobility, the Xbox Adaptive Joystick helps make gaming more accessible for however you play,” the controllers description reads.

At the Microsoft Ability Summit, Jenny Lay-Flurrie the Vice President and Chief Accessibility Officer at Xbox said, With more than 429 million players with disabilities worldwide, we know each player has unique needs and preferences for how they choose to play.”

She continued, “The Xbox Adaptive Joystick is a singular, wired controller primarily designed to meet the needs of players with limited mobility. Its versatility helps players seamlessly incorporate it into their existing gaming setups.”

The Xbox Adaptive Controller is available now.

Join the discussion about the Xbox Adaptive Controller on our official Insider Gaming community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fallout 76’s Ghoul Within update, which lets players transform into a Ghoul. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: F1 25 Release Date Leaks Online Ahead Of Reveal
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/f1-25-release-date-leaks-online-ahead-of-reveal/

F1 25 is set to be revealed next week, that’s according to known data miner billbil-kun. In addition to the game’s full reveal date, we also know the expected release date for F1 25.

According to billbil-kun, F1 25 will be revealed on March 26, 2025. At that time it’ll be announced that the game will release on May 30, 2025.

F1 25 will launch with two editions for players: Standard and a new Iconic Edition. The standard edition will cost $59,99 and release on May 30. The Iconic Edition, however, will retail for $79.99 and give three days early access starting May 27. Those with EA Play and/or Xbox Game Pass Ultimate will get a 10-hour trailer of the game upon release.

What still isn’t known as of publishing is what else will come with the Iconic Edition of the game. It’s also currently unclear if F1 25 will be available on the last-gen Xbox One and PlayStation 4.

What are you hoping to see from F1 25? Let us know down below and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read why EA sources are confident an agreement to continue the licensing agreement between the studio and the NFL will happen. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Rainbow 6 Siege is the Latest Game to Collaborate with The Boys
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rainbow-6-siege-is-the-latest-game-to-collaborate-with-the-boys/

The Boys’ collaborations in the gaming world are popping up left, right, and centre, with the latest one being with Rainbow 6 Siege.

Rainbow 6 Siege The Boys Bundles

The collaboration between The Boys and Rainbow 6 Siege introduces new bundles to the game, which include Operator skins, weapon skins and charms. The first bundle is called the Ace Homelander Bundle, and it turns the Operator into one of the main antagonists from The Boys, with his themed weapon skin and charm. Similarly, the other bundle sees the Operator, Deimos, put on the Black Noir outfit, along with his special weapon skin and charm. 

Rainbow 6 Siege is not the first game to collaborate with The Boys. We have already seen characters from the popular Amazon Prime Video series appear in several games, with A-train and others arriving for Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3, Soldier Boy coming to The Last Fortress: Underground, Homelander coming to Mortal Kombat 1 and more. Per the Rainbow 6 Siege website, The Boys bundle will cost 4080 R6 Credits and is only available for a limited time. 

In other news, Ubisoft recently announced the new 6v6 mode for Rainbow Six Siege X, Dual Front, which players can test through their closed beta. Also, Ubisoft has prepared an “anti-harassment plan” for Assassin’s Creed Shadows. What are your thoughts on Rainbow Six Siege’s The Boys Bundles? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Fallout 76’s Ghoul Within update, which lets players transform into a Ghoul. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
